intro: Campanula trachelium var. secundiflora, commonly known as the purple harebell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal and stem leaves that are lance-shaped with a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full to partial sunlight, often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is cultivated in gardens for its striking floral display.
